page.title: 15The Priory Church
page.content: Much to the surprise of visitors to the Priory,it is today,as it was in the middle ages,a thriving Parish Church,at the very heart of the local community. In social terms,it possesses the usual range of Church organisations, bellringers,choristers,mission groups, sick visitors and a veritable army of volunteer cleaners,the'holy dusters' as they are known.On the electoral roll there are well over 1000 names, many of them from many miles away,such is the pull of the place.The Priory has a reputation for fine music and is very popular for weddings. The building provides the perfect setting for major services such as Remembrance Sunday but the highspot of the year is undoubtedly the Christmas Eve Midnight Communion when 1400 people literally pack themselves in the Church.
